history.content:
Honestly, I would highly suggest taking all of them before taking 189 (you will get the most of the class and be able to concentrate on the actual ML rather than filling in gaps in background material). Also, I would consider replacing Math 110 with EE127 if you care only about ML (since it specializes in lin alg applications to optimization, which will be in alignment with the mindset of 189). If you want to get a broader perspective on linear algebra (or are a math major), take 110 or H110. However, 110/H110 will be less pertinent to 189 (but more useful for abstract math courses like 113, H104/105/202A etc.). 

Edit: If you want to prioritize, I would say EE 126 & EE 127 before Math 53. If you can't take 53, make sure you learn gradients, lagrange multipliers, multiple integrals/derivatives, and matrix calculus.

Honestly, I would highly suggest taking all of them before taking 189 (you will get the most of the class and be able to concentrate on the actual ML rather than filling in gaps in background material). Honestly, I would highly suggest taking all of them before taking 189 (you will get the most of the class and be able to concentrate on the actual ML rather than filling in gaps in background material). Also, I would consider replacing Math 110 with EE127 if you care only about ML (since it specializes in lin alg applications to optimization, which will be in alignment with 189). If you want to get a broader perspective on linear algebra (or are a math major), take 110 or H110.

I have taken CS 70, EE 16A, and 54 already and I want to take 170 along with one of the 3 courses I mentioned in the Spring. My goal is to prepare as well as I can for 189 in Fall 2018. Any recommendations on which to take in the Spring? Maybe also a course to take concurrently with 189 in the Fall? Thanks!
history.subject: Math 53, Math 110 or EE 126?
